oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 g
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 g. Newspaper clipping: 'Good Citizenship Class To Hold Called Meeting.' [1920?]
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: GOOD CITIZENSHIP CLASS TO HOLD CALLED MEETING It had been decided that the class in citizenship would not meet in April, but the decision of the supreme court on April 9, on the legality of the ratification of the 19th amendment of the federal constitution by the Tennessee legislature and the passage by this legislature of several laws of special interest to women, has, in the opinion of the chairman made a meeting this week almost imperative. Thursday at the Lawson McGhee library, promptly at 3 o'clock. The meeting will be held and the following resolution submitted to the class: "In commemoration of the making of the Volunteer state the 'perfect thirty- six' of the union, it is recommended that April 9th be celebrated in Tennessee as Citizens' day." All interested in state laws are invited to attend.
